premise: Joe and Jim were running errands together.  They had a lot to do and very little time to do it, so they experienced a lot of what?

Given the question 'Joe and Jim were running errands together.  They had a lot to do and very little time to do it, so they experienced a lot of what?', which among the choices stress, aggravation, efficiency, tiredness net gain, is the correct answer? Explain your reasoning using conditional statements.
rationale: 1. The correct answer is (A) stress. My reasoning is: If Joe and Jim had a lot to do and very little time to do it, then they experienced a lot of stress. Stress is the feeling of being under pressure or overwhelmed by a situation. Aggravation, efficiency, tiredness, and net gain are not directly related to the situation.
